definition: Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

sentences.english: The other was “Hong Kong people ruling Hong Kong”.
Today, more than 3 years, Hong Kong people have any good ideas ideas?
sentences.chinese: 時至今日，3年有餘，港人對此有何高招妙法？

sentences.english: Swiss people take the road of science and technology, creating well-known brand.
sentences.chinese: 瑞港人走科技之路，創知名品牌。

sentences.english: The children of Hong Kong residents living in China fighting for the right of abode in Hong Kong is a typical example.
sentences.chinese: 港人內地子女爭取居港便是一個典型的事例。

sentences.english: Secondly, British refugee's policy was one of the causes.
sentences.chinese: 第二，英國慷港人之慨的難民政策。

sentences.english: Elsie Leung and Regina Ip conspire to place a knife above our heads.
sentences.chinese: 梁愛詩和葉劉淑怡，要把一把刀放在港人頭上。

sentences.english: 'It's part of Hong Kong people seeking their own identity and roots.'
sentences.chinese: 此乃港人追求自我認同和尋根的一種表現。

sentences.english: Discrimination against ethnic minorities could hamper Hong Kong's bid to become a world class city.
sentences.chinese: 港人歧視少數民族，會防礙香港成爲世界級都會。

definition: (Tw) tourist from mainland China/illegal immigrant from mainland China
chief executive of Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong or Macao)/abbr. for 特別行政區首席執行官|特别行政区首席执行官
British colonial administration of Hong Kong 1837-1941 and 1945-1997
to love Hong Kong (usually implying that one also supports the PRC government)
Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
abbr. for Macao 澳門|澳门/abbr. for Australia 澳大利亞|澳大利亚
